intro: Microchilus rioesmeraldae, commonly known as the Rio Esmeralda fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high levels of moisture and well-drained, acidic soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Its unique morphology and restricted range make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
